name: Loss of availability of information and/or service
description: Repository is unable to provide a comprehensive range of services or access to all of its information holdings for which access ought to be available.
notes:
- Does repository commit to defined service levels?
- Does repository provide assurances of information availability? 

The full description of this risk has been obtained from examples provided in DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment, March 2007, Digital Curation Centre (DCC) and Digital Preservation Europe (DPE), http://www.repositoryaudit.eu/
preMitigationNotes: - Repository’s servers fail, rendering a proportion of its collections inaccessible, although contracts stipulate that access should be afforded
mitigationStrategy:
Avoidance strategies:
- Ensure policies and procedures are conceived with due consideration of any service levels that the repository has committed to
- Ensure software and hardware systems and preservation strategies are capable of meeting service levels In the event of risk’s execution:
- Invoke treatment strategies to alleviate loss of reputation or trust
identifiedBy: DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment
